name: thunderbots
text: this is how many questions in life get answered

name: 7a65726f
text: But on just this page, okay buddy?

name: greyfield
text: One must ask how Philippe found out about Playboy Adviser in the first place without reading any of the other pages.

name: soticoto
text: He must have wondered where Ray learnt all that stuff about bubbles and the alcohol content of booze... and gone looking.

name: goriasxy
text: The Playboy Advisor people are so friendly, all trying to keep Philippe's innocence intact.

name: kilovictorsierra
text: I like to think Philippe includes flavored stickers with all his correspondence.

name: tellumo
text: The thought of Philippe asking questions of the Playboy Advisor is kinda cute and kinda messed up. In other words, it's classic Philippe.

name: pants
text: no phillipe, don't turn the page...

name: paperboy_2000
text: If Philippe turns the page he will find a picture of Shayla from the University of Redlands wearing nothing but high heels and grape-flavored stickers.

name: andrew_
text: Redlands is known(by me) to have creepy older, portlier girls who like it and get even creepier when you say you listen to weezer.

name: lexsenthur
text: A chubby for your avatar. What happens when Philippe, in a fit of rebellion, turns the page.

name: belgand
text: Creepier how?

name: liesandperfidy
text:
Oh Jesus fucking Christ I went to that school and dropped out after a year, possibly due to creepy portly chicks.

AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHFLASHBACK

name: gigs
text:
Women wearing nothing but stickers.

Hello new internet fetish.

name: howard
text: dang phillipe looks pretty surreptitious in panel 4.

name: zem
text: Lyle liked the sound of "Feh" so much that he decided to repeat it

name: deus
text: pft!

name: dougthehead
text: It's hilarious how the Playboy adviser seems to intuitively know the correct way to respond to each of Achewood's members.  Frankly, the idea of Playboy, a nudie magazine with intelligent and articulate writing, is pretty damn funny in and of itself.

name: gowerski
text: All nudie magazines have to have serious articles, so you can be half serious when you claim you only read it for the articles.

name: molesticide
text:
i've been known to respect playboy's opinion at times. they're on the mark, every now and then, especially with media reviews.

i was actually, NO JOKE, reading playboy for the articles once, when somebody demanded to know what i was doing with it. i was about to answer truthfully when i caught myself, felt embarassed, laughed, flipped the page and started looking at tits.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Way in the past they were a pretty great literary source. Can't say I've looked at a mag recently, what with the intertron supplying all the smut needs one could have and all.

name: bixschmix
text: I was interviewed in Playboy a few months ago. It allowed all my friends to purchase the issue and then make jokes about seeing me in Playboy and/or only reading it for the article.

name: woodenteeth
text: I find it strange that no one has asked you why you were being interviewed in Playboy. So, this is my question to you...

name: bixschmix
text:
I wrote an advice column for the lovelorn and socially inept while I was in college. Playboy interviewed a half-dozen of us for an article in last year's "college issue."

Actually, the coolest part of the whole experience was that when the editor sent me my complimentary copies, he also included a reprint of the original Marilyn Monroe issue. Now THAT was cool to read through.

name: boredom_man
text: (looks at original Farrah Fawcett that he carefully shrink-wrapped, sighs in defeat)

name: cracklewater
text:
No way is that a defeat, man! Shrink-wrapping Farrah is an achievement in itself!

Did you leave any holes for her to breathe or eat through?

name: woodenteeth
text: What was the advice column like from THAT issue??

name: shutup_shutup
text:
Dear Playboy,

I am from the past. Please help.

name: tekende
text:
Dear Playboy,

Lately I am at a loss as to the place of hats in menswear. It seems that lately people aren't wearing hats as much, and I fear I have wasted a lot of money on fedoras I shall now never need.

name: bixschmix
text:
Dear Anonymous in OK-

Any girl worth her salt is turned on by a fedora. Plus, then she can "borrow" it, put it on and look really cute. Hat styles come and go-- if it's a classic look, it shall endure.

Bix "Likes To Wear Newsboy Hats When It Rains Like It Did Yesterday" Schmix

name: neoboman
text: This has got to be one of my favorites.

name: soilentshuggah
text: Feh!

name: deancain29
text: Panel 4 - Philippe's Sean Connery impersonation? whos with me?

name: deancain29
text: A comment left by deancain29 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by erincandy, aHatOfPig, Siah)

name: estutius
text: A comment left by estutius was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by molesticide, snoozebar, Siah)

name: goosey
text: I've known people who actually did think the Bill of Rights was what policemen read to you when you get arrested. I'm not American and even I know better.

name: stuart
text: What's up with the title of this one?

name: fineoakstructure
text: Um, what do you mean?  It's just a line from the strip, I believe.  And also a 100% accurate description of the women in those mags.

name: stuart
text: I don't see it anywhere in the text, and Playboy in my experience goes more for only the surface of the butt. Hustler is the place to go for that kind of, ahem, "spread".

name: stuart
text: Instant Correction: oh shit i can't read never mind

name: fineoakstructure
text: But see, that's the whole thing.  Playmates get their polymer sphincters all rouged up even though they ain't gonna be shown, just in case of unexpected glare.  I think it's their philosophy.

name: i_love_kate
text: Polymer Sphincter joins the AssetBar collection of awesome ideas for band names.

name: farqussus
text: Unexpected sphincter glare is the BANE of a photographer's existence.

name: tekende
text: It is basically a thing all wedding photographers dread

name: saru
text:
It's not a description of the women. Note he doesn't say, "The same rouged plastic asshole s ," but rather, "rouged plastic asshole," referring to the quality of the magazine itself. A tarted up, fake, sphincter of a periodical.
And, :sigh: I supposed this is my obligatory, "I say this now! Squeee!" Achewood post, because, well, I say this now. Squeee.
I'm also still on the look out for someone wearing a cape, so I can tell them not to, and something bad enough to describe as being worst song, played on ugliest guitar.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Squee?

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I was wondering the same thing.

But, back to saru's comments: yeah, you could be right, but not necessarily. He may have used the singular simply to say that it's the same asshole - same ass - same model, essentially, from issue to issue, complaining that they all look the same, you can't tell one rouged asshole from another, etc.

We're probably overanalyzing this.

name: hyetal
text: No, you're definitely over-analyzing this.

name: stuart
text: It's not the rouged plastic asshole Lyle has a problem with, it's the lack of variety in types of assholes, like "I don't get Pictures for Sad Children, it's the same Roast Beef strip month after month".

name: dasilodavi
text: That second "Feh!" shows how much Lyle disdains Playboy, I mean, he's really on a twist about it!

name: heccibiggs
text: "Disdain" is not a verb.

name: mashisoyo
text:
...it totally can be.

Sometimes.

name: dasilodavi
text:
http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/disdain

Yes. Yes it is.

name: frankieteardrop
text: morale was low at the playboy advisory.

name: c_dizzle
text: I. Love. You. So. Much. ,. Philippe.

name: stuart
text: Comma, period.

name: c_dizzle
text: consistency is key.

name: hyetal
text: And it's that very consistency that earns you a chubby.  Well done, sir.

name: sagoon
text: feh! why do i even subscribe?

name: kelissamunz
text: I love this one--I love how nice the Advisor is to Philippe with regards to those stickers.

name: heccibiggs
text: I cannot stop laughing at the idea of a policeman reading the entire Bill of Rights every time he arrests someone.

name: tekende
text: You do not have the right to purchase alcoholic beverages. Never mind, you now have the right to purchase alcoholic beverages if you are over the age of 21.

name: baryonyx
text: No one said it could be done.

text:

text: I will go ahead and say I loved the alt text in this one. :-)

text: The alt text made it worth bequeathing a 5 upon.

name: captain_arlo
text: Scratch and sniff stickers are flavored stickers if you burn your tongue pretty badly.  That way the smells are all that are left.  Scent is an important part of tasting, after all.     ...After all that tasting.

text: has anyone noticed how Lyle says feckin'? I dunno how to explain it but that makes this so much more awesome..

text: Father Ted?
